DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether telavancin (TD-6424, ARBELIC) can be safety administered to patients with bloodstream infections and whether telavancin is effective in treating these infections.
DOC.brief_title: Telavancin for Treatment of Uncomplicated Staphylococcus Aureus Bacteremia
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Documented S. aureus bacteremia Exclusion Criteria Patients who had received or would have received more than 72 hours of potentially effective systemic antistaphylococcal therapy within 7 days prior to randomization. The following agents were considered potentially effective antistaphylococcal therapy: antistaphylococcal penicillins (including nafcillin, oxacillin, or cloxacillin), cephalosporins, fluoroquinolones, glycopeptides (including vancomycin and teicoplanin) and linezolid
